attributes.action: Reopen NHS walk in centres around Harrow
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the closing down of full services and operating on limited appointments only the patients are suffering a lot. Getting an appointment with registered GP is like winning a lottery these days. 
Since patients are unable to use these facilities they either end up going to A&E or waiting for paramedics to be seen which puts unnecessary strain on already stretched A&E and ambulance services.
attributes.background: Alexandra Avenue Health & Social Care Centre, Pinn Medical Centre and similar NHS walk in centres were a major part of the community pre covid and really helped a lot of patients - who were unable to get on the day appointments with their own GPs - to be seen quickly by another doctor or Nurses.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.  This is a decision for the local NHS trusts

You might want to contact your local MP about the issue you want to raise. You can find out who that is and how to contact them here:

https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
